chargeHist.descr: Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (>$500 - $5000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
08-11-2015:  0 day sentence credit due if revoked from probation.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

59 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation
Consecutive to: to prison sentence
